callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

callousness.question: Did you turn away from someone who was ill, leaving them to suffer alone?
callousness.description: This is sinful because it violates Jesus's direct command to care for the sick (Matthew 25:36) and fails to fulfill our fundamental Christian duty to show compassion and mercy to those who are suffering.

blasphemy.question: Did you use God's name in vain, swearing at Him?
blasphemy.description: This sin violates the Second Commandment by treating God's holy name with disrespect rather than reverence.

blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly having unrepented, mortal sins in your heart?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of sin
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of sin, potentially offending God through my actions?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of sin that profanes the real presence of Christ
blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion in my life while knowingly in a state of sin that profanes the real presence of Christ?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to cloud my decisions, especially when interacting with those in positions of authority or influence?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of professional advancement and leadership roles
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of professional advancement and leadership roles allow me to dominate others, using my influence for personal gain rather than serving them humbly?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Has my accumulation of possessions and wealth become an ultimate driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: by exercising unjust or cruel authority over them
oppression.question: Have I, through my words and actions, mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others by exercising unjust or cruel authority over them?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: by exercising unjust power or authority over them
oppression.question: Did you mistreat others by exercising unjust power or authority over them, causing harm or suffering in your dealings?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did you use your authority, influence, or position to mistreat others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' accomplishments and secretly wished they would struggle to achieve them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I looked at others' blessings with discontent, wishing they would lose what I perceive as better than mine?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in speaking to others with vulgar or inappropriate language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, demonstrating an excessive attachment to worldly pleasures?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively prioritized entertainment, leisure activities, or material possessions over my financial responsibilities and family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing someone's private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: with Sunday 's holy day of rest
impiety.question: Did I allow my work to interfere with Sunday's holy day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

anger.question: Have I held onto anger, or nursed feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
